Package org.jboss.elemento.svg

package org.jboss.elemento.svg
Provides classes and interfaces for creating and manipulating SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) elements using a fluent builder API.

This package offers a type-safe, builder-based approach to working with SVG elements in GWT and J2CL applications. It provides factory methods, element wrappers, and builder interfaces for common SVG elements and containers.

Key Classes

SVG
Main entry point with static factory methods for creating SVG elements (svg, circle, rect, path, etc.)
SVGElement
Base interface for all SVG DOM elements, corresponding to the W3C SVGElement specification
SVGElementBuilder
Builder for simple SVG elements with methods for attributes, classes, events, and styling
SVGContainerBuilder
Builder for container-like SVG elements that can hold child elements

Use the static methods in SVG to create SVG elements: 

svg().css("spinner", "large")
        .aria("label", "Loading...")
        .attr("role", "progressbar")
        .attr("viewBox", "0 0 100 100")
        .add(circle().css("spinner", "path")
                .attr("cx", 50)
                .attr("cy", 50)
                .attr("r", 45)
                .attr("fill", "none"));

Supported Elements

The package provides factory methods for the following SVG elements:

  • svg - Root SVG container
  • circle - Circle shape
  • ellipse - Ellipse shape
  • g - Group container
  • line - Line shape
  • path - Path shape with complex curves and lines
  • polygon - Polygon shape
  • rect - Rectangle shape
  • text - Text element
See Also:

    Description
    org.jboss.elemento
    Elemento simplifies working with GWT Elemental2 by providing a fluent API for building HTML element hierarchies, typesafe CSS selectors, and helper methods for common DOM operations.
    org.jboss.elemento.flow
    Provides an API for executing asynchronous tasks in parallel, sequentially, or repeatedly based on conditions.
    org.jboss.elemento.intl
    Provides type-safe Java mappings for the JavaScript Intl API, enabling locale-aware formatting of dates, times, numbers, lists, durations, and relative times.
    org.jboss.elemento.logger
    Provides a lightweight logging wrapper around console.log that uses categories, log levels, and a predefined log format.
    org.jboss.elemento.mathml
    Provides support for creating and manipulating MathML (Mathematical Markup Language) elements using a fluent builder API.
    org.jboss.elemento.router
    Provides a minimally invasive client-side routing solution for single-page applications.
  • Class
    Description
    SVG
     
    SVGCircleElement
    The SVGCircleElement interface is an interface for the <circle> element.
    SVGContainerBuilder<E extends SVGElement>
    Builder for container-like SVG elements.
    SVGElement
    All the SVG DOM interfaces that correspond directly to elements in the SVG language derive from the SVGElement interface.
    SVGElementBuilder<E extends SVGElement>
    Builder for simple SVG elements.
    SVGElementDataMethods<E extends SVGElement, B extends TypedBuilder<E,B>>
    Provides methods and default implementations for modifying the data set of SVG elements.
    SVGElementStyleMethods<E extends SVGElement, B extends TypedBuilder<E,B>>
    Provides methods and default implementations for modifying the style of SVG elements.
    SVGEllipseElement
    The SVGEllipseElement interface provides access to the properties of <ellipse> elements.
    SVGGElement
    The SVGGElement interface corresponds to the <g> element.
    SVGLineElement
    The SVGLineElement interface provides access to the properties of <line> elements, as well as methods to manipulate them.
    SVGPathElement
    The SVGPathElement interface corresponds to the <path> element.
    SVGPolygonElement
    The SVGPolygonElement interface provides access to the properties of <polygon> elements, as well as methods to manipulate them.
    SVGRectElement
    The SVGRectElement interface provides access to the properties of <rect> elements, as well as methods to manipulate them.
    SVGTextElement
    The SVGTextElement interface corresponds to the <text> elements.
